frqParts.text: This problem deals with functions defined by f(x) = x + b sin x, where b is a positive constant and −2π ≤ x ≤ 2π. (a) Sketch the graphs of two of these functions, y = x + sin x and y = x + 3 sin x.
(b) Find the x-coordinates of all points, −2π ≤ x ≤ 2π, where the line y = x + b is tangent to the graph of f(x) = x + b sin x.
(c) Are the points of tangency described in part (b) relative maximum points of f? Why?
(d) For all values of b > 0 , show that all inflection points of the graph of f lie on the line y = x.
